channel.title: Free vbulletin- Legal
channel.description:
I found a site that gives you free vbulletin forums.
Go to forumdrop.com, and register for it.
I looked on vbulletin.com, and someone had asked about it and an administrator said it was 100% legal.

item.title: Free vbulletin- Legal
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

On another topic

That’s because they don’t have the responsibility of checking what each client does in detail, but they’d shit themselves if they were told by another company that one of their clients is hosting illegal software.

This. ISPs like the DMCA, because it gives them immunity to copyright laws as long as they act to remove stuff once notified of it by the copyright holder. They aren’t going to ignore a takedown request just for your measly couple of dollars a month.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vbulletin- Legal
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:13, topic:234571”][quote author=the bank link=topic=309278.msg2476075#msg2476075 date=1223254489]

If you download illegal version anyone can just fuck it up and nobody will join anyways.
[/quote]Err, what?

@runescape3dude
vbulletin has a nack of reporting your site and getting it taken down if someone finds out.

Host it yourself. Noone can control you, except your ISP. But, I don’t think my ISP cares what I do…

That is why I hack someones valid license, or I use phpbb/smf[/quote]This is true, as logn as the ISPs get their money, they tend to stay out of things unless approached by a 3rd party.

Read full topic

item.title: Free vbulletin- Legal
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:11, topic:234571”][quote author=stormcutter link=topic=309278.msg2476070#msg2476070 date=1223254377]
If you download illegal version anyone can just fuck it up and nobody will join anyways.
[/quote]Err, what?

@runescape3dude
vbulletin has a nack of reporting your site and getting it taken down if someone finds out.[/quote]
Host it yourself. Noone can control you, except your ISP. But, I don’t think my ISP cares what I do…

That is why I hack someones valid license, or I use phpbb/smf

Read full topic

For example check out

http://www.nasforum.net/

It’s exactly the same as regular vbulletin except with a forumdrop toolbar at the top.[/quote]

item.title: Free vbulletin- Legal
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:235014”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=309278.msg2474823#msg2474823 date=1223195819]

* No Cost
* Run any forum software
* You have full control of site
* [b]No control of Ads[/b]
* Limited Support

Wtf? That’s a killer in advertising…

Surely someone could add some js shit to stop any adverts?

Surely, we could sue them for giving vbulletin away for free?
[/quote]
They probably either pay royalties or paid for a special package that allows them to legally distribute the software. That’s if stormcutter was right about it being legal…[/quote]

they might be paying per copy with the ad money…

Read full topic
